results.title: A Fish called Wanda
results.creator_credit: Charles Crichton, Michael Shamberg and Prominent Features
results.brief_description: The culture clash between the English and Americans is the subject of this offbeat romantic caper, written by John Cleese and directed by veteran Charles Crichton. The “Yanks” are Wanda (Jamie Lee Curtis) and her lover/partner in crime, Otto (Kevin Kline). The “Brits” are barrister, Archie Leach (John Cleese) and Ken (Michael Palin), a stuttering animal rights activist and criminal. A diamond heist brings them together, as they all attempt to confiscate the hidden loot behind each others backs. A romantic quadrangle adds to the fun.

results.title: A Fight for breath: emphysema
results.creator_credit: Joe Licastro, Floyd Elliott and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A film aimed at youngsters tempted by cigarettes but also for all those already addicted. Why a man suffering from emphysema has difficulty breathing is graphically illustrated. The entire respiratory system is shown in animated cross-sectional models, down to the smallest air cells, the alveoli. That is where the breakdown begins that eventually leads to impaired pulmonary function. This internal view of the damage done to the lungs is one that no viewer can ignore.

results.title: A Figgy Duff Christmas
results.creator_credit: William Gough, Rex Tasker, Canadian Broadcasting Corporation and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: For hundreds of years, Newfoundlanders have been celebrating Christmas, developing distinct traditions. One of these is figgy duff pudding. A musical group, named after the traditional dessert, play and sing the old songs sung at that time of the year.

results.title: A Few good men
results.creator_credit: Rob Reiner, Andrew Scheinman, David Brown, Castle Rock Entertainment and Columbia
results.brief_description: A young Marine is brutalised by two fellow Marines at the United States Navy Base in Cuba. The bashing ends in the young Marine’s death. It looks like a simple case but a methodical US Navy lawyer (Demi Moore) is keen to investigate the killing, convinced that the bashing was a result of a “Code Red”, an unofficial system of bastardry which aims to convert the young marines into effective fighting machines. “A Few Good Men” is a detective story, a film about responsibility and conduct, and it features some powerful and adrenalin-pumping courtroom drama. Tom Cruise is suitably boyish and charming as a maverick Navy lawyer and Jack Nicholson is outstanding as a US General arrogantly convinced of his superiority and power.

results.title: A Farewell to arms
results.creator_credit: Charles Vidor, David O. Selznick, Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation and Selznick Pictures Corporation
results.brief_description: A remake of the 1932 classic tale by famed author Ernest Hemmingway. Rock Hudson stars as an American ambulance driver during World War I. Wounded in action, he is restored to health by an army nurse played by Jennifer Jones. However, their love affair is doomed as the war hangs like a spectre over their lives. Shot on location in the Dolomite region of Italy, the film is sentimentally tragic and never quite reaches the heights of the earlier version. Vittorio De Sica is excellent as the cynical Major Rinaldi, while Hudson and Jones make an attractive couple, but their performances are hampered by a cliched script.

results.creator_credit: Rhoda Leyer, Les Drew, Robert Verrall and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: A Fable
results.creator_credit: Rolf W. Brandis, William Clarkson, Fred A Niles and Xerox
results.brief_description: Like all fables, “A Fable” presents an idea in concrete form. In this case, the benefits of friendly co-operation that entails inevitable risks are contrasted with the miseries of self-imposed hostile isolation that avoids such risks. Shot on location near a 14th century village north of Rome, its cast includes the famous French pantomimist Marcel Marceau. It tells of a story of a man who, in order to protect his property, builds a wall to block out the world and consequently experiences loneliness and despair. The children eventually return and together with the man, pull down the wall and build a bridge across the stream which separates the man’s world and the children’s.

results.title: A Different approach
results.creator_credit: Fern Field, Jim Belcher and Belfern Productions
results.brief_description: A young filmmaker, hired to make a sombre straight-forward film about the reasons employers should hire the disabled, decides instead to take an innovative, irreverent approach to what is usually a piously hush-hush subject. The film shows him screening his film to an incredulous audience and trying to convince them that his different approach is the right one. Stars Michael Keaton with cameo appearances by Martin Mull, Ed Asner, Jim Nabors and Carroll O’Connor.

results.title: A Day in June: Montreal
results.creator_credit: Louis Portugais and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: June 24th is celebrated in Montreal with parade and fanfare in memory of St. Jean Baptiste, the patron saint of Quebec. Now more of an historical than a religeous pageant, the “grande parade” consists of a series of tableaux on floats representing events from French Canada’s colourful past. Using candid camera techniques, the film captures the reactions and behaviour of people participating in a public festivity dear to their hearts. Contains some spoken French language.
